intro: Putoria cymosa, commonly known as the clustered putoria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It has opposite, ovate leaves that are usually hairy on the underside. Putoria cymosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
